description: A simple encoding of terms from a hierarchical taxonomy

Term.description: a description of a term from the taxonomy

term.description: the words that make up a term from the taxonomy at a certain level
notes: This value should not include terms from ancestor/parent terms
The current convention is that the value includes all ancestor terms formatted with the conventional delimiter
Example:  'Information Technology: Cybersecurity' where the parent term is at level 2 and a colon (:) is used to delimite the ancestor levels.

level.description: the 1-based hierarchical level that the term appears in the taxonomy

label.description: a label to use to represent this term in a display

tags.description: labels that can identify the term's use
notes: tags can be arbitrary values, but it is expected that several terms will have a common tag to indicate a common use

Taxonomy.description: a collection of terms that make up a taxnomy

@id.description: a URI identifier for the taxonomy

version.description: a version string for the taxonomy

description.description: an explanatory description of the purpose of the taxonomy

vocab.description: the list of terms in the taxonomy
